channel.title: Blog on Gaurverb
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Gaurverb

item.title: facade and flyweight in Go.
item.description: what? what’re you takin ‘bout? Data Structures Or rather data structural patterns. why do people even learn data structures ? Because that’s how you store or manipulate data in memory.

item.title: sharing is caring.
item.description: Sharing is caring is a cliche but not in when is comes to webapps. Isomorphic web applications are becoming popular and accepted methodology by many in the Game. in dictionary terms, it means something of the corresponding or similar form or relations. Hmm… wth! I know… what is isomorphic, though? isomorphic webapps are when server and client share some common data with each other and thus correspond/relate to each other in a way.

item.title: websockets in Go.
item.description: Btw, there already is a lot of cool resources on websockets in go, this is just for me to yap about ‘em again if you remember. I’ll be building a basic simple chat application that allows user to have live real time conversion over http. This is just to brush up goroutines, channels and concurrency in Go.
